intro: Hesperis matronalis subsp. adzharica, commonly known as the Caucasian sweet rocket, is a perennial herb native to the Caucasus region. It features showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped, hairy leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, often found in rocky or woodland habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for garden cultivation due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
